item.title: Notes
item.description: 2019-02-20 Notes from “Design of syntax trees” meeting Zulip stream We haven’t nailed down the exact design, but we’ve covered the design space a bit, and formulated interesting questions to evaluate designs: What are the requirements of IDEs? Full-fidelity trees, “common super type” of nodes for bottom-up traversals. Should queries reach inside of the syntax tree? In general, how incremental computation works with syntax trees? Offsets are bad for incremental (change a lot), parent pointers are bad for incremental (give access to too much context).
